answers.author: Jayme Bosio
answers.text:
Through the use of State of Florida and local economic incentives, Palm Beach County Government successfully brought Scripps Florida and the Max Planck Society (MPS) to its new biotech research complex located adjacent to the Town of Jupiter campus of Florida Atlantic University. (See the two related PBC information releases.) Scripps: http://www.pbcgov.com/newsroom/0209/02-26-09_Scripps.htm
Planck: http://www.pbcgov.com/newsroom/0907/09-13-07_planck.htm
#


Through the use of State of Florida and local economic incentives, Palm Beach County Government successfully brought Scripps Florida and the Max Planck Society (MPS) to its new biotech research complex located adjacent to the Town of Jupiter campus of Florida Atlantic University. (See the two related PBC information releases.) Scripps: http://www.pbcgov.com/newsroom/0209/02-26-09_Scripps.htm
Planck: http://www.pbcgov.com/newsroom/0907/09-13-07_planck.htm

#

answers.author: [Anonymous]
answers.text:
Hi Matthew:
As a native of Cleveland, OH, I have some personal experience to share with you on this subject.  The Cleveland Clinic was one of the few industries in the city that lasted through the various economic difficulties faced by the city over the years.  This pattern was noticed, and thus brought forth plans to solidify Cleveland as a prime location for biomedical technologies.  The following websites offer a smattering of what has grown up in this industry throughout Cleveland, and have some valuable insights into the process:
http://www.clevelandmeetings.com/cleveland_meetings/planning_tools/biotech/
http://www.healthtechcorridor.com/Facilities/Incubators
http://www.massdevice.com/news/philips-healthcare-injects-33-million-cleveland-medical-imaging-center
I would have to imagine that you could contact the Cleveland Clinic and/or the local government of Cleveland with more direct, specific questions.
I hope this helps!
DeleteEdit


Hi Matthew:

As a native of Cleveland, OH, I have some personal experience to share with you on this subject.  The Cleveland Clinic was one of the few industries in the city that lasted through the various economic difficulties faced by the city over the years.  This pattern was noticed, and thus brought forth plans to solidify Cleveland as a prime location for biomedical technologies.  The following websites offer a smattering of what has grown up in this industry throughout Cleveland, and have some valuable insights into the process:

http://www.clevelandmeetings.com/cleveland_meetings/planning_tools/biotech/
http://www.healthtechcorridor.com/Facilities/Incubators
http://www.massdevice.com/news/philips-healthcare-injects-33-million-cleveland-medical-imaging-center

I would have to imagine that you could contact the Cleveland Clinic and/or the local government of Cleveland with more direct, specific questions.

I hope this helps!

author: Matthew Fulton
text: I am looking for a successful case study relating to the development of an incubator facility.  In my community, there is interest in bio-medical development.  Anyone have any suggestions on projects to explore?
title: bio-med Incubator facilities
